title: Ryder Cup: USA 3½-10½ Europe – rampant visitors eye clean sweep in fourballs
summary: Day two at Bethpage Black features hole-by-hole coverage as Europe looks to capitalize on their strong position. Follow our writers for real-time updates and insights. Tension builds as teams compete for dominance in the tournament.

title: Wright shatters Leeds with last-gasp try to send St Helens into semi-final at Hull KR
summary: St Helens secured a dramatic 16-14 win over Leeds with a last-minute try from Shane Wright. This victory advances them to the Super League semi-finals, where they will face Hull KR. The thrilling match showcased St Helens' resilience and determination.

title: UK government will underwrite £1.5bn loan guarantee to Jaguar Land Rover after cyber-attack
summary: Britain's largest automotive employer is set to resume engine manufacturing in early October. This decision marks a significant move in reviving production efforts within the industry. The resumption aims to bolster the company's operational capabilities and meet demand.

title: Strictly Come Dancing: week one – as it happened
summary: In the debut of the competition, Karen Carney achieved the highest scores, impressing the judges with her performance. Late replacement Amber Davies also garnered attention with her dancing skills. Meanwhile, Ross King found himself at the bottom of the standings.

title: Tottenham 1-1 Wolves: Premier League – as it happened
summary: Wolves nearly secured a win against Tottenham, showcasing strong performance throughout the match. However, in the final moments, Joao Palhinha scored a stunning equalizer for Spurs. The late goal denied Wolves a crucial victory.
